ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When I enter the room, I often scan it for entrances and exits.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: I often feel as if I'm "on guard".
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: When I come to a new place, I usually survey the scene to see if there are possible risks.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription:
If I were to sit in a crowded movie theater, I would always sit in a seat where escape
would be easy.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: When I am out on the street, I am often "looking over my shoulder".
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: I am always aware of situations in which I could be trapped.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: I often check the locks on my house at night to make sure they are secure.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: When I sit in a restaurant, I will typically sit where I can see everything.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: I always try to be aware of objects or places where danger could be lurking.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: I frequently pay attention to even the slightest sound or noise.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: In a crowd, I often wonder whether someone might be hiding a weapon.
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly True; 3 = Somewhat true; 4 = Very True; 5 = Extremely True

ElementDescription: In the past month, as soon as I wake up and for the rest of the day, I am watching for signs of trouble.
Notes: 0 = Never true; 1 = Sometimes true; 2 = Often true; 3 = Very often true; 4 = Always true

ElementDescription: In the past month, when I am outside, I think ahead about what I would do (or where I would go) if someone would try to surprise or harm me.
Notes: 0 = Never true; 1 = Sometimes true; 2 = Often true; 3 = Very often true; 4 = Always true

ElementDescription: In the past month, I notice that when I am in public or new places, I need to scan the crowd or surroundings.
Notes: 0 = Never true; 1 = Sometimes true; 2 = Often true; 3 = Very often true; 4 = Always true

ElementDescription: In the past month, when I am in public, I feel overwhelmed because I cannot keep track of everything going on around me.
Notes: 0 = Never true; 1 = Sometimes true; 2 = Often true; 3 = Very often true; 4 = Always true

ElementDescription: In the past month, I feel that if I don't stay alert and watchful, something bad will happen.
Notes: 0 = Never true; 1 = Sometimes true; 2 = Often true; 3 = Very often true; 4 = Always true

ElementDescription: Total score. Created by adding the responses for all 5 items.
